1.text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.

2.text: Now the Jewsâ€™ feast of tabernacles was at hand.

3.text: His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.

4.text: For [there is] no man [that] doeth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, shew thyself to the world.

5.text: For neither did his brethren believe in him.

6.text: Then Jesus said unto them, My time is not yet come: but your time is alway ready.

7.text: The world cannot hate you; but me it hateth, because I testify of it, that the works thereof are evil.

8.text: Go ye up unto this feast: I go not up yet unto this feast; for my time is not yet full come.

9.text: When he had said these words unto them, he abode [still] in Galilee.

10.text: But when his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.

11.text: Then the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?

12.text: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him: for some said, He is a good man: others said, Nay; but he deceiveth the people.

13.text: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.

14.text: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.

15.text: And the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?

16.text: Jesus answered them, and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.

17.text: If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or [whether] I speak of myself.

18.text: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh his glory that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.

19.text: Did not Moses give you the law, and [yet] none of you keepeth the law? Why go ye about to kill me?

20.text: The people answered and said, Thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee?

21.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, I have done one work, and ye all marvel.

22.text: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision; (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers;) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man.

23.text: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision, that the law of Moses should not be broken; are ye angry at me, because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day?

24.text: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.

25.text: Then said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?

26.text: But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?

27.text: Howbeit we know this man whence he is: but when Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.

28.text: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught, saying, Ye both know me, and ye know whence I am: and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.

29.text: But I know him: for I am from him, and he hath sent me.

30.text: Then they sought to take him: but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.

31.text: And many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ cometh, will he do more miracles than these which this [man] hath done?

32.text: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.

33.text: Then said Jesus unto them, Yet a little while am I with you, and [then] I go unto him that sent me.

34.text: Ye shall seek me, and shall not find [me]: and where I am, [thither] ye cannot come.

35.text: Then said the Jews among themselves, Whither will he go, that we shall not find him? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?

36.text: What [manner of] saying is this that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find [me]: and where I am, [thither] ye cannot come?

37.text: In the last day, that great [day] of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.

38.text: He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.

39.text: (But this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believe on him should receive: for the Holy Ghost was not yet [given]; because that Jesus was not yet glorified.)

40.text: Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.

41.text: Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?

42.text: Hath not the scripture said, That Christ cometh of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?

43.text: So there was a division among the people because of him.

44.text: And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.

45.text: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said unto them, Why have ye not brought him?

46.text: The officers answered, Never man spake like this man.

47.text: Then answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?

48.text: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?

49.text: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed.

50.text: Nicodemus saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)

51.text: Doth our law judge [any] man, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?

52.text: They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search, and look: for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.

53.text: And every man went unto his own house.
